items.title: NASA Awards Third Glenn Facility and Engineering Services Contract - NASA
items.content_text: NASA has selected Troy Sierra JV, LLC of Huntsville, Alabama, to provide engineering, research, and scientific support at the agency’s Glenn Research Center

items.title: NASA Armstrong to Host Partnership Day Oct. 21-22 - NASA
items.content_text: NASA’s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, invites innovative companies, government agencies, and organizations to attend Partnership

items.title: All NASA News - NASA
items.content_text: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

items.title: Space Cargo Out for Delivery Days Before Next Resupply Mission Launches - NASA
items.content_text: One cargo spacecraft is orbiting Earth toward the International Space Station while another stands at its launch pad counting down to a lift off on Sunday to continue resupplying the Expedition 73 crew. The orbital residents will be preparing for the dual cargo missions while keeping up cardiac and bone research over the weekend.

items.title: Progress 93 Cargo Craft Lifts Off to Resupply Station Crew - NASA
items.content_text: The unpiloted Roscosmos Progress 93 spacecraft is safely in orbit, headed for the International Space Station following its launch at 11:54 a.m. EDT (8:54 p.m. Baikonur time) on a Soyuz rocket from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan.

items.title: NASA’s GUARDIAN Tsunami Detection Tech Catches Wave in Real Time
items.content_text: A massive earthquake and subsequent tsunami off Russia in late July tested an experimental detection system that had deployed a critical component just the day before.

items.title: New U.S.-European Sea Level Satellite Will Help Safeguard Ships at Sea
items.content_text: Sea surface height data from the Sentinel-6B satellite, led by NASA and ESA, will help with the development of marine weather forecasts, alerting ships to possible dangers.

items.title: NASA Says Mars Rover Discovered Potential Biosignature Last Year
items.content_text: After a year’s worth of scientific scrutiny, the ‘Sapphire Canyon’ rock sample remains the mission’s best candidate for containing signs of ancient microbial life processes.

items.title: NASA to Share Details of New Perseverance Mars Rover Finding
items.content_text: A news conference this morning will focus on the analysis of a rock sampled by the agency’s Perseverance Mars rover last year, which is the subject of a forthcoming science paper.

items.title: NASA Study: Celestial ‘Accident’ Sheds Light on Jupiter, Saturn Riddle
items.content_text: An unusual cosmic object is helping scientists better understand the chemistry hidden deep in Jupiter and Saturn’s atmospheres — and potentially those of exoplanets.

items.title: NASA to Share Details of New Perseverance Mars Rover Finding
items.content_text: A Sept. 10 media teleconference will focus on the analysis of a rock sampled by the agency’s Perseverance Mars rover last year, which is the subject of a forthcoming science paper.

items.title: Vintage NASA: See Voyager’s 1990 ‘Solar System Family Portrait’ Debut
items.content_text: In archival footage of a historic NASA news conference, the mission reveals history-making images of six planets in our solar system, including a tiny speck called Earth.

items.title: NASA Marsquake Data Reveals Lumpy Nature of Red Planet’s Interior
items.content_text: Rocky material that impacted Mars lies scattered in giant lumps throughout the planet’s mantle, offering clues about Mars’ interior and its ancient past.

items.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
items.content_text: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.
